did.unittitle: David H. Wenrich research materials on Joseph Leidy

bioghist.p: Joseph Leidy (1823-1891) was one of the preeminent figures in the development of American science in the nineteenth century. He was a physician, naturalist, anatomist, and scientific illustrator. Following William Wagner's death in 1885, Leidy assumed the role of President of the Faculty of the Wagner Free Institute of Science, with special direction of the Biology Department. Leidy was Chairman of the Board of Curators at the Academy of Natural Sciences in Philadelphia, and is a central figure in that institution's history. He also taught courses at the University of Pennsylvania and at Swarthmore College.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials collected by David H. Wenrich for a proposed biography of Joseph Leidy. Materials include: handwritten and typescript drafts; correspondence with libraries and museums requesting information on Leidy correspondence and other items; notes, transcriptions, and photostats of original Leidy materials; correspondence from Academy staff regarding Wenrich's biography; copy of a memoir by Henry C. Chapman on Leidy; microfilm of Leidy letters in the Smithsonian Institute, the Library of Congress, the University of Rochester, and the National Archives; reprints; and photographs. The collection also includes notes and correspondence from Joseph Leidy II (Leidy's nephew) related to his own biographical project, a few original Leidy drawings of rhizopods (circa 1877), and several indexes related to Leidy's work.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: College of Physicians of Philadelphia: Joseph Leidy papers; Wagner Free Institute of Science: various Joseph Leidy collections.
